review_2: the game runs at 36 fps ( checked with OVR metrics ). the graphics are very simple and the arenas are small so there is no excuse for the atrocious performance the movement of the enemies and bullets is choppy which is unacceptable in a rhythm Game. also only Your guns must be flred to the beat. the movements and attacks of the enemies aren't synched to the music as You would expect from rhythm based games such as necrodancer or bullets per minute. not recommended
review_3: It's always going to be tough to follow in the footsteps of Pistol Whip, but Gun Jam VR is a superb alternative if you're looking for more of the same. The enemies and guns are varied enough for this to feel different to Pistol Whip. Not quite as polished as Pistol Whip, however it's very well presented, the guns feel great, and the music is very good. I love the weapons. Please provide a mode where you don't have to shoot to the beat and up the fire rate on the guns, as well as enabling the option to fire them at the same time. Highly recommended!
